config.description: Name of the project environment (development, staging, production)

apiKey.description: This will be used for authentication on Heroku. You can find it in your heroku homepage account settings

email.description: Email that you use to authenticate on Heroku

repositoryName.description: Name of the GitHub repository, to create connection

org.description: Heroku team name and organization name in Github.

serviceUser.description: Heroku team member used to automate deployment and manage|operate the deployed application. This user will be added to the app as a collaborator.

buildPacks.description: Ordered list of builpacks that should be added, see https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/using-multiple-buildpacks-for-an-app.

addons.description: List of addons that should be present, in the format <addon_plan_name>#<alias> where alias is optional, see https://elements.heroku.com/addons.

webhook.description: Webhook to register on Heroku, see https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/app-webhooks

secret.description: Webhook secret to override the one autogenerated by Heroku during webhook registration

drain.description: Log drain to register on Heroku, see https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/log-drains

branch.description: The branch that you would like to deploy to Heroku. Defaults to 'HEAD'

useForce.description: Set this to true if you want to use --force when switching branches

resetRepo.description: Set this to true if you want to reset Heroku target repo

watchDelay.description: Time (in seconds) to wait before closing deploy listener. Defaults to 10 seconds

healthcheck.description: A URL to which a healthcheck is performed (checks for 200 request)

checkString.description: Value to check for when conducting healthcheck requests

healthcheckDelay.description: Time (in seconds) to wait before performing healthcheck. Defaults to 0 seconds

rollbackOnHealthcheckFailed.description: When set to true this will attempt to rollback to the previous release if the healthcheck fails
